intro: Sessea rugosa, commonly known as the rough sesse, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink and are borne in small clusters. Sessea rugosa is often found in woodland and forested areas, where it thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil.
